data.title: Outstanding food.  Best atmosphere in KC.
data.text: It feels like a place that you'd walk into somewhere in New York, Chicago San Francisco or Washington DC.  Total class.  Absolute attention to detail.  1920's architecture meets 2020's interior design.  And then the food; as good, or better than anything else in KC.  It isn't a well know place, but it should be.  A few Out-of-Towner's using Marriott Points to stay at the hotel were the only other diners... a hidden gem, i guess.

data.title: BEST Restaurant in KC
data.text: Easily the best restaurant in KC.  Very elegant atmosphere, but not at all pretentious.  Phenomenal truffle deviled eggs! Coq au Vin was amazing.  Everything is picture perfect and tastes fabulous.  GREAT service, very attentive but not over-bearing.  Can't wait to go back!!!

data.title: Wonderful
data.text: Stayed at the hotel, ate here twice. It's quaint, low kwy atmosphere is great after a long day. The staff are nice and not too attentive. Happy hour includes an assortment of appetizers, portions are large. A perfect lemon drop martini and not to be missed steamed mussels in white wine mushroom sauce. Put this one on your list in Kansas City.

data.title: Outstanding Serivce, Wonderful Food
data.text:
I dined at the Reserve inside the Ambassador Hotel last week and was blown away by the whole experience!
From the service to the food, this place is top notch.
Mary Kate was our server for the evening. Her knowledge about the menu, our drink selection and even the Kansas City area was impressive. I have never experienced such wonderful customer service in my life. 
The restaurant itself is located inside the Ambassador Hotel and it is beautiful! 
Last but not least the food was amazing!  I have heard about the Chef many times in the news and was not disappointed in the cuisine.
I will recommend this place to everyone I know for a date night. From Mary Kate to the food to the decor, this place is beautiful!

data.title: Dinner at The Reserve
data.text: My husband and I took my mother and daughter in law to The Reserve before a show at the Kaufmann Center last Saturday evening.  We had a wonderful dining experience!  The Reserve is a beautiful space, and the wait staff was excellent as was all our dinners.  We wish more people were aware of The Reserve located inside the Ambassador Hotel.  Hotel dining is not always the best place to enjoy dinner, but The Reserve is the exception, and we would highly recommend it!

data.title: Fantastic Restaurant!
data.text: This is no ordinary hotel restaurant, it is fantastic!  I didn't want to go anywhere else to eat during my weekend stay. I had breakfast, lunch (twice) and dinner here and everything I had was delicious. The atmosphere is very relaxed and comfortable - great couches, nice lighting, luxe furnishings. The staff is very nice and accommodating, including special requests.

data.title: A wonderful breakfast
data.text: Let me start by saying, I had a few requests, and they were very accommodating. Breakfast on average is 10-12 dollars. You will leave full. Portions are generous and food delicious. You will not be disappointed by stopping in here for a quick bite.

data.title: Great Tastes
data.text: Had breakfast 2 days in a row and it was delicious. Great service also. Only issues was one of my husband's massive pancakes was undercooked on one visit but with the size, he couldn't finish his meal anyhow.

data.title: A KC dining MUST!
data.text: Fantastic fare! Creative Mixology! Very sexy atmosphere! Intimate style dining in cocoon like seating. Great service and wonderful food! We will be back!

data.title: A Hidden KC Gem
data.text: I had drinks and a light dinner here with colleagues. I never knew this hotel or restaurant even existed. It was quaint and beautifully appointed. The food was excellent and the service was also top-notch. Perfect place for a quiet dinner for two or for entertaining clients or guests.

data.title: Great Manhattan in KC...
data.text: Got in late on a Monday night and had wonderful cocktail...Woodford Reserve Manhattan and lovely tomato bisque.  Food was fresh, hot and delicious...and the Manhattan hit the spot...in the setting of a beautifully restored lobby!

data.title: Superior Atmosphere & Service
data.text: Reserve is located in the beautiful lobby of the Ambassador Hotel in Downtown Kansas City.  As a guest of the hotel, my friend and I took advantage of the bar and restaurant this weekend.  We had a very delightful time, were treated phenomenally by the restaurant's staff and the drink selections were numerous.  I highly recommend the spicy bloody Mary and the breakfast potatoes and sausage

data.title: Hip Decor
data.text: During a brief visit to Kansas City, I walked around to get a feel for the city. I poked my head into this charming boutique hotel and was amazed at the décor. I felt like I was walking into a 2015 version of the art deco period. My friend and I sat and had drinks and dinner at the bar and had a great time. Great stop for a quick walk-around in the lobby, a drink or dinner.

data.title: A very special place
data.text: Chef Shaun was over the top in accommodating my special needs... Service and food both excellent... It was like we were in a boutique hotel /restaurant in NY or Chicago

data.title: Nice atmosphere food ok
data.text: Really good atmosphere, food ok for what you pay. I would suggest more for a date or for a glass of wine, not if you want to enjoy the food

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: I ordered the stuffed salmon for dinner. It was amazing. So tasty. The bread is also very good. For breakfast I ordered an omelet which was very good as well. Pricing was moderate and worth it. Service was excellent.

data.title: My favorite place to go before a performance at the Kauffman Performing Arts Center
data.text: This is a gem for Happy Hour. They have a great selection of $5.00 small plates, my favorites are the sliders and truffled devil eggs, and every day has its own special.  Monday's is an excellent hamburger, fresh made potato chips and a glass of wine or beer for $10.00.  I have enjoyed everything I have ever ordered.  The service is wonderful and the servers and manager remembered me from previous visits. The acoustics make it easy to have a conversation with the people you are with and the chairs are very comfortable. I only have accolades for this restaurant.

data.title: Great happy hour
data.text: Superb $5 small plates for HH and good cocktail specials. Mary Kate offered great service. Nice cozy atmosphere with sophisticated ambient jazz music. Great evening in the big city. We'll be back.

data.title: great coq and very quiet
data.text: In town for a convention, I was flying solo and found Reserve near my hotel. My reservation wasn't necessary. They have great furniture, and I got a wonderful chair with high sides against the wall. Chalis took great care of me and mixed a terrific gin and tonic. I had a garden salad that was exquisite with roasted red peppers and goat cheese with big chunks of toasted bread and garlic oil. I had the coq au vin, which tasted great with fingerling potatoes and savory sauce. The background music was at a perfect volume with very tasteful classical guitar alternating with piano trio version of pop, rock, and jazz tunes. Total was $50 with tip.

data.title: Quality food, Professional staff!
data.text: We ate both dinner and breakfast at the Reserve.  ( Named Reserve because the location, in the Ambassador Hotel, was once a bank's vault.)  Our servers were personable, attentive yet seemingly knew when to offer service without becoming bothersome.  I ordered the coq au vin and my husband got the lamb.  Both selections were excellent! We felt the prices most reasonable for a downtown hotel.  Servers Charles and Mary Kate personified professionalism at our evening meal.  Alex was helpful and provided not only great service but also descriptions of the menu while offering warm, genuine hospitality. Plus, Alex kept our morning coffee filled.  A good thing because it is excellent coffee!
